name: provokingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is intended to be annoying: "You haven't changed, I see," remarked Ethel provokingly. He found the English provokingly lacking in curiosity about other nations.
More examplesFewer examplesHe provokingly refused to accept this joke as an insult. She was sometimes provokingly unwilling to complete her manual labours.I soon grew tired of studying them, as they appeared so provokingly mindless, and heartless, and artificial.He had certainly behaved provokingly, but it was nobody else's business.
